intro: Hydrostachys verruculosa f. ciliata, commonly known as the ciliated hydrostachys, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, ciliate leaves that give it its specific epithet. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, often forming dense mats that help stabilize aquatic environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, usually in whorls, and are often pink or purple in color. Hydrostachys verruculosa f. ciliata plays an important ecological role in supporting aquatic biodiversity and water filtration.
